article_title: Michael Boskin: California Dreamin’ of a Legacy
article_text:
Jerry Brown—now in the last of his second pair of terms as governor of California—should command broad national attention and not only as a possible presidential candidate if Hillary Clinton falters.

Mr. Brown’s policies are more complex and nuanced than a typical big-spending liberal in a blue state. He plans, at great cost to consumers, to mandate that 50% of the electricity generated in the state be from renewables such as solar...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, Michael Boskin writes that Jerry Brown’s popularity isn’t in doubt, but his fiscal record is. He still has time to put the state on solid footing.
twitter.title: California Dreamin’ of a Legacy
